data.Title: Google Discontinues Continuous Scroll in Search Results
data.Description: Google is discontinuing the continuous scroll feature in its search results, reverting to the classic pagination bar. The change aims to improve search speed and is expected to be implemented on mobile search soon.

data.Title: Google Debunks Branded Keyword SEO Myth
data.Description: Google clarifies that using branded keywords in content does not negatively impact search rankings, contradicting a common SEO myth. The company emphasizes that creating helpful content for users, which may naturally include brand mentions, is paramount.

data.Title: Google Updates Sitemap Documentation
data.Description: Google has updated its sitemap documentation, adding clarification that the "lastmod" value should reflect the date and time of the last significant update to a page.

data.Title: Google to Automate Lead Credits for Local Services Ads
data.Description: Google announces the automation of lead credits for Local Services Ads, starting next month. The move has sparked discussions about its potential benefits and drawbacks for advertisers.

data.Title: Google Search Console Validation Tools Use Different Crawler
data.Description: A reminder that Google Search Console validation tools, such as the URL Inspection tool and Rich Results Test, utilize a different crawler (Google-InspectionTool) than the actual Googlebot used for indexing websites.

data.Title: Perion Network Announces Layoffs
data.Description: Perion Network, a digital advertising company, is laying off 35 employees (6% of its workforce) as part of cost-cutting measures. The layoffs are attributed to Microsoft's pricing policy changes for the Bing search engine, which impacted Perion's revenue.

data.Title: YouTube Tests "Hype" Feature for Videos
data.Description: YouTube is experimenting with a new feature called "Hype" that allows viewers to boost videos in the "Explore" section. However, it's important to note that "Hypes" will not influence search rankings or YouTube's discovery system.

data.Title: Amazon Developing AI Chatbot "Metis"
data.Description: Amazon is reportedly developing an AI-powered chatbot codenamed "Metis" to compete with ChatGPT. The chatbot is expected to leverage Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to provide up-to-date responses and is tentatively slated for a September launch.

data.Title: Google Increases AI Overviews for Health Queries
data.Description: Google Search is once again prominently displaying AI Overviews for health-related search queries after a period of reduced visibility. This development has implications for content creators and SEO strategies in the health information domain.

data.Title: Google Developing Customizable AI Chatbots
data.Description: Google is reportedly developing a product that enables users to create personalized AI-powered chatbots. These chatbots could potentially be modeled after celebrities, offering a unique and engaging user experience. The product is expected to launch as early as 2024.

data.Title: Google's Credit Card Widgets Disrupt Affiliate Marketing
data.Description: Google's introduction of credit card carousels and widgets in search results is poised to significantly impact the credit card affiliate marketing industry. The prominent placement of these features could disrupt traditional affiliate marketing strategies.

data.Title: Google Experiments with New Sitelink Designs
data.Description: Google is testing various sitelink formats and designs in its search results. These experiments include different colors, shapes, and visual elements, potentially impacting how sitelinks appear and perform in search.

data.Title: Oracle's Ad Business Decline Impacts Industry
data.Description: The decline of Oracle's advertising business is leading to layoffs and uncertainty within the advertising industry. As Oracle scales back its ad operations, the ripple effects are being felt across the industry, raising questions about future trends and opportunities.

data.Title: Marketer Preparedness for Post-Cookie World Declines
data.Description: Marketers are showing a decline in preparedness for the phasing out of third-party cookies, with a 23% drop in readiness compared to 2022. This lack of preparedness raises concerns about the industry's ability to adapt to a privacy-focused digital advertising landscape.

data.Title: New Standards for Sustainability Measurement in Media
data.Description: GARM's Rob Rakowitz discusses the development of new standards for measuring sustainability in the advertising ecosystem. These standards aim to provide a common framework for evaluating and improving the environmental impact of advertising operations.
